info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 7:03PM EDT until July 28 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following counties, Cuyahoga and Medina.
* WHEN...Until 1015 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 703 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cleveland, Medina, Parma, Lakewood, Strongsville, Brunswick, Westlake, North Royalton, Wadsworth, Rittman, Lodi, Creston, Chippewa Lake, North Olmsted, Parma Heights, Rocky River, Broadview Heights, Brook Park, Berea and Fairview Park.
- Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING
